review_title: Do you love working more than your family?
job_title: Acute Dialysis RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Want to make money? Do you like starting your day early and ending it late? How do you feel about sleeping at the hospital for a few hours before your next shift starts? If you're ready to go all in, you could stop paying social security taxes before the end of the year. If you can take all that and like to be allowed the freedom to structure your day and prioritize as you like, this job is truly worth it's weight in gold. JCAHO usually avoids you, and you really only deal with the nephrologists directly. They learn to trust and rely upon you and there's the kind of true collaboration that RN's rarely get to experience.
cons: When you're not at work, you're on call. If you get called in, it will be for a minimum of 6 hours. Money is nice, but at some points in your life, it's not worth enough to make up for the lack of family time.

job_title: Food Service Assistant in Middleburg Heights, OH
pros: Flexible scheduling, good immediate managers, it's a great first job that isn't fast food service, better than minimum wage, reasonable number of patients to serve.
cons: Don't bother with anyone above the immediate managers as they're disrespectful, it's a revolving door of employees, cleanup at the end of the night is dreadful but you get through it.

job_title: Housekeeper in San Antonio, TX
pros: I loved the staff on 3 shift. I enjoyed working ER especially and intake.
cons: Would like to see the 3 shift make more than 9.45 an hour and get compensated for working 3 shift.

job_title: Paramedic in Cleveland, OH
pros: good pay, nice people. caring mgt
cons: halftime for most positions, very few full time

job_title: Mental Health Specialist in San Antonio, TX
pros: The cafeteria provides food and also coffee thru shifts

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: There are a few very nice fellow employees
cons:
Take your License and RUN!! If you want to keep it!!
Many nurses just mess around and do not take the time or effort to take care of patients, to answer call lights, to help patients to the restrooms, or to medicate them in a timely manner.

job_title: Director in San Antonio, TX
pros: Great leadership support and teamwork
cons: There have not been any raises or pay increases going on 4 years now.

job_title: Staff RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Small 300 bed hospital, most staff friendly and helpful.  Good cafeteria food, lots of vegetables which are never overcooked.  Good MDs and RNs.  Wonderful head nurse and assistant head nurse.
cons: Inferior software.  ER, outpt surgery, and regular hospital floor's software do not "talk" to each other.  Wheeled computers frequently not working.  Often  difficult to find wheel chairs, walkers.  (Patients, visitors, family members probably are taking some of these.)  Inadequate staffing of nurses,  (7 patients of very high acuity/1 RN) and often no unit clerks or enough CNAs.  Pay is less than other hospitals in San Antonio.

review_title: RN license on the line! Lawsuits!
job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: Sometimes you get 2 nursing assistant per floor. Sometimes you get to work with co workers who help out each other.
cons: Team nursing- 14 patients :1 RN, 1LVN and they share a nursing assistant for the whole floor. Before this LVN's would just require an RN to co sign.  Not anymore, RN must do all assessments, must make sure all meds are given appropriately, chart checks done on all patients, and give report on 14 patients.  Report alone takes a whole hour.  Then RN's usually stay 2 to 3 hours after their shift is over trying to catch up on charting. You never get to know your patients because its just impossible. There's one RT for the whole hospital, there's one radiology tech, and lab tech at night. So good luck when there's a code. Your license is on the line.

review_title: A Hospital That Needs to Improve It's Service, Quality and Attitude or It Will Continue to Lose Patients and Physicians
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Antonio, TX
pros: It serves the poor in San Antonio and is the only hospital in that part of the city.
cons:
They need to rethink their management, marketing and services to the community.  There is too much favoritism,  nepotism, and all too often people are hired who are cronies but have little if any skill for the job they were hired to do.

The turnover in management has only complicated the line of authority and given the doctors and staff the impression that IASIS, the corporation that owns the hospital, doesn't know what they're doing.  

Physicians complain that the equipment on the floors is substandard, is not maintained in good working order or is absent from the floors.  They also want more nurses on the floors to care for the patients.  They have noticed that a number of staff members have become surly and rude to their patients.  Medication errors are all too frequent.

Patients complain that the nurses ignore them when they call for assistance and are often irritable.

job_title: CERTIFIED SURGICAL TECHNOLOGIY in San Antonio, TX
pros: I have my clinic rotation at this hospital. I had a good experience because I learned a lot about sterilization, safety procedures, maintain the sterile surgical field, HIPPA, working on team, prioritizer the patient first, standar precautions, assist to the surgeon and surgical team over 200 surgical cases in differents specialities.
cons: Discrimination, block to growth up in the surgical career, working with people without compassion

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: They hire new grads. Great place to get experience. Small hospital that everyone knows you. 10-12 week orientation (Kinda).
cons: Even though they may preach about safety and quality care, they bottom line is profitability. This leads to commonly unsafe nurse- patient ratios. They expect you to take 7 patients in med-surg. To make it even more unsafe they have team nursing, where you take 14 patients with the help of an LPN.

review_title: I loved working in the emergency room with my fello associates

job_title: RN in San Antonio, TX
